title: Cliffs Notes on Mythology (gnv64)
description:
Cliffs Notes on Mythology
By James Weigel, Jr., M.A.
Cliffs Notes Inc | 1973 | ISBN 0-8220-1485-8 | PDF | 210 pages | 12.3 mb

The original CliffsNotes study guides offer expert commentary on major themes, plots, characters, literary devices, and historical background.In CliffsNotes on Mythology, you'll review the myths from seven different cultures and gain an overview of the stories that people have lived by from ancient times to the present. The gods and their stories depict life's lessons and personal relationships and present a moral code of human conduct. These stories are also a map to understanding history.
This CliffsNotes guide covers Egyptian, Babylonian, Indian, Greek, Roman, and Norse mythologies, as well as the Arthurian legends. 

Features that help you figure out these important works include:
An introduction to mythology
The main gods of various cultures
Review questions
Recommended readings
Genealogical tables of major gods
Classic literature or modern-day treasure â€” you'll understand it all with expert information and insight from CliffsNotes study guides.

CONTENTS
PREFACE 
INTRODUCTION TO MYTHOLOGY
EGYPTIAN MYTHOLOGY.
BABYLONIAN MYTHOLOGY
INDIAN MYTHOLOGY
GREEK MYTHOLOGY
ROMAN MYTHOLOGY
NORSE MYTHOLOGY
ARTHURIAN LEGENDS
BIBLIOGRAPHICAL ESSAY
REVIEW QUESTIONS
RECOMMENDED READING
GENEALOGICAL TABLES
INDEX

Also included is an ePUB version and an audiobook sample.
